answers.text:
Hello,
Thanks for reaching out to us to help answer your question! I found a few resources that I think highlight some valuable options for you to consider.
Through use of new software, the City of Peoria, AZ was able to consolidate its business licensing and bid system divisions. (http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/9127/Automated_Business_Practices_Peoria_Arizona_Case_Study)
Loudoun County, Virginia was able to use the web to offer citizens an easier way to file tax declarations and renew their business licenses. (http://icma.org/en/Article/10035/Loudoun_Becomes_First_in_Virginia_with_Online_Business_Property_Reporting)
You can learn more about innovative reporting mechanisms in the Business Retention and E-Government topic pages.
I hope this answer was helpful. Please feel free to reach out to us again when you need help answering a question or finding resources. 
Aloha,
James Davidson
Knowledge Network Intern

author: [Anonymous]
text: Has your city/town/county made use of technology to centralize numerous business licensing and regulatory requirements? I would like to see examples that allow prospective and current business owners to identify licensing and regualtory needs by business type, and ideally offer the ability to apply and pay for them online.
title: Online Business Licensing and Regulatory Portals
